Joe, please reread my tweet in the morning, or have someone else take a look at it and talk it over.  In the tweet you‚Äôre complaining about, I said states ALSO get two electoral votes not based on population.

States are already allocated electors in the electoral college based on population. A state with 2x the pop. gets 2x the electors as the smaller state in the EC. Additionally every state gets 2 electors not based on pop.  Those 2 electors were inconsequential in Trump‚Äôs victory.
Like != endorsement... except in the case of your last tweet.  queue Dos Equis meme please.

I also posted in my reply to @QuentinConway.  Take the number of states won by Trump.  Multiply by two (that‚Äôs the ‚Äúoverrepresentation‚Äù factor). Subtract the result from his electoral total.  Do the same for Hillary (incl DC). Trump still has a higher electoral total.
Math is hard.

I think we misunderstand each other.  Most who complain about the electoral college criticize the fact that it assigns every state two additional electors, not based on population. Many of those believe, mistakenly, that this feature of the EC is responsible for Trump‚Äôs victory.

Here‚Äôs the easiest way to do the math: take the number of states Trump won, multiply by 2 and subtract the result from his electoral college total.  Do the same thing for Clinton (ok to include DC).  Compare their electoral votes.  He still has more.

But the disparity between popular vote result and electoral college result is not due to the intentional protection (or some might say over representation) of small states prescribed by the Constitution.

But many do gripe about it and in the context of this last election specifically... leaving no doubt that they haven‚Äôt done the math, are acting tribally, and are just repeating what they‚Äôve heard (or misheard).

What if I told you that the disproportionate representation of smaller states designed into the electoral college had nothing to do with Trump‚Äôs victory and it‚Äôs mathematically provable?  I‚Äôm sure some would deny the fact, because after 2 years, they‚Äôve still not done the math.
